Description: Planned Home Zone application for a 100% affordable, six-story, 55-unit multi-family rental development, prioritizing local educators. Includes 32 parking spaces and bike storage. Received approval from PTC and City Council.
Proposed ordinance related to bird-friendly design, mentioned as going to City Council.

Regular updates on parking data, including University Avenue garage/lot occupancy, sales data, and RPP permit sales. Implementation of new permit management and citation vendor and APGS systems in large garages. Policy changes for RPP employee permits and low-income permits.

Project: Safe Streets for All Safety Action Plan
Description: Draft plan to improve road safety, aiming for zero KSI (killed or severely injured). Focuses on eligibility for state/federal grants, sustainability, and accommodating new residents from housing element. Approved by City Council on June 2nd.
Update to the ordinance related to stream corridors, with public discussion.

On-demand shared ride transit pilot program, discussion on funding (City, Stanford Research Park, grants), operational model, and data tracking for users (youth, senior, wheelchair, low-income discount).

Permanent installation project with a traffic oval and bulbout. Previous discussions focused on design, traffic data, and accessibility concerns for residents. The five-way intersection oval design was approved, while the bulbout portion was continued and later postponed.

Project: California Avenue & Ramona Street Permanent Closure
Address: Portions of California Avenue and Ramona Street
Description: Reclassification of portions of California Avenue (between El Camino Real and Birch Street) as a Community Street and Ramona Street (between University and Hamilton) as a Pedestrian Street. Aims to enhance outdoor dining, retail, and economic vibrancy.

Project: El Camino Real Repaving and Bike Lane Project (Caltrans)
Description: Ongoing Caltrans project for repaving and adding bike lanes. Status updates include striping completion, quick curbs installation, no parking signage, and electrical signal detection.

Vesting tentative map for condominium subdivision to create 29 new townhome-style units. Includes affordable housing (4 on-site moderate-income units plus in-lieu fee) and energy efficiency features. Approved by PTC and City Council.

Project: Bicycle and Pedestrian Transportation Plan Update
Description: Study session on a conceptual plan for a safe and inclusive bike/pedestrian system, aiming to bring standards into the modern era and integrate population growth. Feedback sought on new bikeways/connections.

Project: El Camino Real Focus Area (Ordinance Amendment)
Description: Amendment to the ordinance implementing Housing Element program 3.4C 4C. Involves expanding geographic boundaries, adjusting development standards, affordable housing requirements, and special setbacks. Approved by City Council with additional modifications.

Project: South Palo Alto Bike Ped Connectivity Project
Description: Project to improve bicycle and pedestrian accessibility across the rail corridor in southern Palo Alto. Identifies locally preferred crossing locations and design concepts for two new grade-separated crossings (15% designs).

Annual review of new capital improvement projects (e.g., natural environment, community services, transportation, land use) for consistency with the Comprehensive Plan. Includes vehicle and equipment replacement funding.
Ordinance update to respond to Housing and Community Development (HCD) comments, addressing deferment of impact fees and streamlining the lien process. Approved by City Council on May 12th.
Planned Community project. City Council remanded to PTC for additional redesign, specifically requesting removal of third-floor units to reduce height/bulk, aiming for 11-13 units instead of 16.
Pre-screening for a potential Planned Community zoning application to consider additional dwelling units, for a property recently approved for development.
Pre-screening for a potential Planned Community zoning application to consider additional dwelling units, for a property recently approved for development.

State bill allowing for subdivision up to 10 lots (ministerial process), with local governments setting regulations. City Council approved an urgency ordinance. PTC will review for a permanent ordinance.

Update on master planning process for Cubberly site (35 acres), exploring three conceptual site layouts and circulation plans. Contingent on a future bond measure. Focus on flexibility, inclusivity, sustainability, and affordability.

Request for a Conditional Use Permit (CUP) to allow private university use (Stanford Door School of Sustainability) within an existing, formerly vacant building. Includes ADA, HVAC, electrical, lighting, and fire safety improvements. PTC recommended approval to City Council.

Project: San Antonio Road Area Plan Update
Description: First discussion on initial work, outreach, and next steps for the area plan update.
Pre-screening for a future housing development project under the Planned Community (PHC) process.
Pre-screening for a future housing development project under the Planned Community (PHC) process.
